introduction: Impatiens capensis, the orange jewelweed, common jewelweed, spotted jewelweed, jewelweed,[3] spotted touch-me-not, or orange balsam,[4] is an annual plant in the family Balsaminaceae that is native to North America.[5] It is common in bottomland soils, ditches, and along creeks, often growing side by side with its less common relative, yellow jewelweed (I. pallida).
